entries: 如果维克纳(Vecna)未能通过一次豁免投掷，他可以选择成功。

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: 维克纳 (Vecna) 在对抗法术和其他魔法效果的豁免 throws 中拥有优势。

trait.name: Regeneration (Eye and Hand Only)
entries: Vecna在他的回合开始时恢复20点生命值，如果他至少有1点生命值。

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: Vecna对于那些使不死生物变化的效果免疫。

trait.name: Eye and Hand of Vecna
entries: 如果Vecna拥有{@item Eye of Vecna}和/或{@item Hand of Vecna}，而不是使用这些物品的统计数据，他将获得额外的特性和能力，如此统计数据中所述。

trait.name: X-Ray Vision (Eye Only)
entries: Vecna（维克纳）可以看穿实体物质，范围达120英尺。对他来说，在这个半径内的实体物体看起来是透明的，不会阻止光线穿过它们。

trait.name: Aura of Weakening
entries: Vecna（维克纳）散发出负能量光环，覆盖半径为30英尺，当他的任一神话特性激活时，光环范围扩大至60英尺。在光环内，维克纳的不死盟友在所有豁免 throws 上获得优势，而生物在所有属性检定上获得劣势，并且无法恢复生命值。

trait.name: Vecna's Ambition (Mythic Trait; Once Per Rest)
entries: 如果维克纳(Vecna)的生命值降至0点，他并不会死亡或倒下{@condition unconscious}。相反，他会重置到最大生命值，并可以立即采取行动，但直到下一回合结束前，他不能使用他的传奇抗性特性。

trait.name: Limited Rejuvenation (Mythic Trait; Once Per Rest)
entries: 如果维克纳（Vecna）死亡，他的身体会在下一个回合开始时重新形成，生命值恢复到最大值，并再次活跃起来。然后他会获得一个持续1小时的魔法飞行速度，速度为30英尺。

action.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 19} 进行攻击，射程5英尺，一个生物。造成19({@damage 3d6 + 2d8})点冰冷伤害。目标必须成功通过一次{@dc 25}宪法豁免才能免疫1分钟的麻痹状态（豁免结束）。

action.name: Liquify Bones (Hand Only; Recharge {@dice d6|6})
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 19} 命中，达到5英尺，一个生物。{@h} 目标剩余1点生命值。

action.name: Change Shape
entries: Vecna（维克纳）可以魔法变形成为他曾见过的任何生物，保留他的游戏统计数据（除了体型）。如果Vecna被减至0点生命值或使用他的动作来结束变形，这个变形就会结束。

legendaryHeader: 维克纳可以执行5个传奇动作，可以从以下选项中选择。每次只能使用一个传奇动作，并且只能在另一个生物的回合结束时使用。维克纳在自己的回合开始时会恢复已使用的传奇动作。

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: 维克纳传送到他能看到的一个未被占据的空间，最多30英尺。

legendary.name: Ray of Death
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 19} 进行攻击，射程60英尺，目标为一名敌人。造成 {@h} 28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) 点死灵伤害。

legendary.name: Paralyzing Touch (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: 维克纳使用了他的麻痹之触（Vecna）.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 or 3 Actions)
entries: 维克纳(Vecna)施放一个施法时间为一个行动或奖励行动的法术。如果这个法术有造成伤害的能力，那么它的消耗为3个传奇行动，而不是2个。

legendary.name: Vile Curse (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Vecna瞄准他能看到的距离30英尺内的一名生物。目标必须成功进行一次{@dc 27}感知豁免才能避免被施加魔法诅咒。在被诅咒期间，目标在攻击投掷和豁免投掷上有劣势（豁免结束）。

mythicHeader: If one of Vecna's mythic traits were activated in the last hour, he can use the first three options below as legendary actions. If both traits were activated in the last hour, he can instead use any of the options below.

mythic.name: Greater Teleport
entries: 维克纳传送到他能看到的一个未被占据的空间，距离最多60英尺。

mythic.name: Beam of Death
entries: 维克纳释放一道负能量射线，宽5英尺，长100英尺。区域内的每个生物受到28点({@damage 4d8 + 10})死灵伤害（豁免 DC 27 体质豁免成功减半）。

mythic.name: Dark Speech
entries: 维克纳(Vecna)迫使他能看到的距离60英尺内的一名生物进行一次{@dc 27}感知豁免投掷。未通过豁免的目标将在其接下来的回合结束前，被死亡和毁灭的幻觉所{@condition blinded}和{@condition deafened}。如果目标对此免疫，它在豁免时获得优势。

mythic.name: Undying Grasp (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: 维克纳（Vecna）瞄准他能看到的最多五个生物，距离他不超过60英尺。每个目标都会被传送到维克纳能看到的一个未被占据的空间，距离他不超过60英尺。该空间必须在地面上或地板上。

mythic.name: Whispers of Madness (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: 维克纳选择他能看到的最多三个生物，距离他不超过60英尺。每个目标必须成功通过一个 {@dc 27} 感知豁免才行，否则将受到32 ({@damage 4d10 + 10}) 精神伤害，并且必须使用其反应对维克纳能看到的一个生物进行近战武器攻击。

mythic.name: Necrotic Web (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: 维克纳释放了一个以他能看到的点为中心的死灵蛛网，范围为120英尺。该点周围15英尺内的每个生物受到43({@damage 6d10 + 10})点死灵伤害（强韧豁免 DC 27，成功豁免减半）。未通过豁免的生物还会被麻痹（持续1分钟，成功豁免结束；未通过豁免则受到{@damage 4d6}点死灵伤害）。
使用此能力后的1分钟内，网覆盖的区域成为艰难地形，而在该区域结束回合的生物必须进行此能力开头描述的初始豁免投掷。

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: 谜题的施法能力是智力（法术豁免{@dc 15}）。它准备了以下法术：

trait.name: Horrific Visage (Flesh Ripper Only)
entries: 在谜题开始的每个回合，每个能看见它的在15英尺范围内的生物必须进行一次{@dc 15}智力豁免检定，否则会受到10({@damage 3d6})点精神伤害。

trait.name: Flesh Ripper Rage (Once Per Rest)
entries: 一旦谜题被{@condition bloodied|LM}解开，它将经历一次邪恶的转变，持续1小时。在此期间，谜题无法施放法术，并获得一组新的特质和能力。

trait.name: Regeneration (Flesh Ripper Only)
entries: 谜团在每个回合开始时恢复10点生命值，如果它至少有1点生命值。

trait.name: Blood Frenzy (Flesh Ripper Only)
entries: 谜题怪兽对任何生物的近战攻击投掷获得优势，只要该生物是{@condition bloodied|LM}。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 术士进行两次近战攻击。

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7}攻击，射程5英尺或射程20/60英尺，目标一个。造成{@h}6({@damage 1d4 + 4})穿刺伤害加上10({@damage 3d6})闪电伤害。

action.name: Rend Flesh (Flesh Ripper Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7}攻击，射程10英尺，目标一个。{@h} 18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) 点割伤伤害，并且谜题可以将目标推开多达10英尺。

action.name: Shock Bolt (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7}攻击，射程90英尺，一名生物。受到{@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) 闪电伤害，并且直到其下一个回合结束前，目标的速度减半，不能作出反应。

action.name: Memory Ripper {@recharge 4}
entries: 谜团撕裂生物的记忆，范围为60英尺内的20英尺立方体。该区域内的每个目标会受到9({@damage 2d8})点精神伤害（智力豁免成功则伤害减半）。未通过豁免的目标还会在其下一个回合结束前变为{@condition stunned}，并且谜团会奇迹般地了解目标的一个事实或秘密。

entries.name: Abominations
entries: 虽然他们永葆年轻，但不朽者也会死去，当他们死去时，有些会以扭曲的形态重生，与他们曾经的模样大相径庭。大多数可怕的畸变体是在诸神与原初之间的战争中作为武器而被创造出来的，但极少数是在宇宙混沌力量的作用下自发产生的。当这些存在苏醒时，他们充满愤怒，只渴望传播毁灭和绝望。

This creature's hairless, overlarge head surmounts its wet, wrinkled, and bloated humanoid body. Its eyes are glassy and vacant. Its arms are too slender, and its tiny hands end in cruelly sharpened nails, while its legs are atrophied, dead things that hang useless below it.

Atropal scions are clots of divine flesh given form and animation by terrible catastrophies, bleak-hearted gods of death, or pure chance. When a stillborn godling rises spontaneously as an undead, an {@creature atropal|ToA} is born. If that atropal is defeated, but any fragment or cast-off bit of flesh remains, an atropal scion may yet arise from those fragments, lessened in power from its divine beginnings, but no less hateful for its stature.

An atropal scion is a power to be reckoned with, and once animate in the world, seeks power over both life and unlife in an unrelenting bid for domination that only its lifeless tissue is able to sustain.

entries.name: Combat
entries: An atropal scion prefers to float high above the field of combat, relentlessly summoning specters and using Life Drain indiscriminately to take care of threats when possible. If it is {@condition bloodied|LM}, the atropal lets out a screech and begins using its mobility in a more tactical manner. It also takes advantage of its Negative Energy Aura to rebuke melee opponents and its {@spell dispel magic} ability to counter spellcasters as it sees fit.

entries.name: Lore
entries: A character knows the following information with a successful check made using the {@skill Arcana} or {@skill Religion} skill.

entries.name: DC 20
entries: Unlike normal atropals, atropal scions are imbued with foul magic that grants them a smidgen of spellcasting. Given enough time, an atropal scion may evolve into a threat much greater than the undead it originally splintered off of.

entries.name: DC 25
entries: Atropal scions have the power to summon specters to their aid, but their ability to magically locate creatures is far deadlier. Lacking qualities such as impatience and stamina that living creatures possess, an atropal scion will use this ability to find undead allies and amass an army, and to track down powerful enemies that would threaten its cause.

A sprawling morass of mud, rotting vines, dead animals, and writhing tendrils emerges from beneath the earth. Seemingly in pain, the abomination lets out a horrific shriek before resuming its rampage and destroying the terrain around it.

The rotvine defiler has but one purpose: to ingest and spoil all that is living. A profane vestige of a powerful immortal devoted to fertility, the rotvine defiler seeks to destroy that which it has lost—life. In its wake, the creature leaves a trail of despoiled organic matter, a record of its vindictive mission.

entries.name: Combat
entries: A rotvine defiler burrows through the ground, sending up tentacles to grab living creatures.
If it is {@condition bloodied|LM} or slain, the defiler releases an explosion of desecrating fumes that wither ally and enemy alike.

entries.name: Lore
entries: A character knows the following information with a successful check made using the {@skill Nature} or {@skill Religion} skills.

entries.name: DC 15
entries: A rotvine defiler is the profane remnant of an immortal being of primal origins devoted to nature or agriculture. The corrupted immortals were slain and sealed under the ground, where the seeds of evil caused them to return to life and outwardly manifest their malevolence.

entries.name: DC 20
entries: A rotvine defiler arises when a creature makes a sacrifice over the monster's earthly tomb, breaking the seals containing it. The creature usually retains none of its original intelligence or memories.

The being before you possesses the basic shape of an angel, but between the red energy crackling from its wings and sword and the twisted, malicious expression on its face, this abomination is a clear perversion of all things holy.

At the dawn of creation, mighty {@creature couatl|mm|couatls}—winged serpents of purity and virtue—strove to bind evil elementals and fiends. The titanic spiritual struggle sometimes resulted in the death of both entities and brought about a terrible fusion of body and spirit. From these morbid unions arose discord incarnates—perverse abominations bent on wanton destruction.

entries.name: Combat
entries: A discord incarnate immediately flies in among its foes, attempting to position itself within reach of as many enemies as possible. If it is {@condition bloodied|LM}, it shifts tactics and attempts to lock down the most vulnerable targets possible using its Rush of Pain and Unholy Pull abilities. A discord incarnate is a remorseless foe and never retreats except to seek a new tactical position.

entries.name: Lore
entries: A character knows the following information with a successful check made using the {@skill Religion} skill.

entries.name: DC 20
entries: Discord incarnates arose during the cosmic war between the gods and the primordials. After that conflict, these creatures were destroyed or imprisoned throughout the planes. Whenever a discord incarnate breaks free of its prison, it roves the planes, destroying everything in its path.

Even from inside a cosmic prison, a discord incarnate can dream fiends spectral undead into existence. Couatls, winged serpents of purity and virtue, work hard to keep discord incarnates and their minions contained within otherworldly prisons. However, even their power has limits. Couatls regard discord incarnates and the mockeries as their greatest failure.

entries.name: DC 25
entries: Scholars speculate that a discord incarnate spontaneously arises from the clash of two powerful, opposing forces—a powerful demon and a couatl. Some experts suggest that the profane union is the work of a now-forgotten god or primordial that saw benefit in the creation of the twisted monstrosities. It is even possible that a cache of discord incarnates could yet lie hidden in the cosmos, awaiting some event or signal from their creator that stirs them to action.

entries.name: Blightspawn
entries: 腐臭且令人作呕，枯萎使者(blightspawn)无论走到哪里都会带来瘟疫和疾病，威胁着如果不加以控制就会让生者受到其疾病和毒药的污染。
The horrible creature walking into view is a mass of free-roaming intestines, flaccid organs, and a few odd rib bones. Dragging behind it like a dead weight is a lolling, maggot-ridden humanoid head.
A skulking cyst is disgorged from the rotting corpse of a living creature, born of a necrotic cyst that eventually kills its host (see the {@spell necrotic cyst|LM} spell).

A skulking cyst prefers shadows and dark corners, only revealing the horror of its form when it strikes lone victims from hiding. Though often cloaked in the detritus of a previous victim, the skulking cyst's true "heart" is a 1-foot-diameter spherical sac that contains fluid and semisolid necrotic flesh, which slowly undulates as if in a mockery of breath.

entries.name: Combat
entries: A creature of shadows, a skulking cyst prefers to launch attacks on lone victims from dark ceilings and sewer grates.

This frigid corpse is so cold that it is frosted with icy crystals. Sensing the warmth of life, it shambles eagerly toward its victims. Its eyes reflect the vacuum of the void, its touch chills to the bone, and its very presence seems to drain the heat from your pores.

When inactive, a bleakborn appears to be nothing but a humanoid corpse, slain either by bitterly cold conditions (or if in a warmer environment, as if by a magical cold attack so potent that the corpse still sparkles with ice crystals). However, whenever any living creature comes to within 30 feet of an inactive bleakborn, the warmth and life of the interloper revive the undead creature, giving it purpose and an icy semblance of life.
A bleakborn is not marked by direct violence; rather, it looks like a humanoid that has been flash-frozen, with discoloration and some ruptured flesh showing here and there.
A bleakborn stands a little over 6 feet tall and weighs between 150 and 230 pounds.

entries.name: Combat
entries: A bleakborn actively moves toward living creatures, attempting to keep them within range of its heat-draining aura. If possible, a bleakborn pummels a living creature with its ice-cold limbs, hoping to deprive its victim of all warmth and life.

entries.name: Lore
entries: A character knows the following information with a successful check made using the {@skill History} skill.

entries.name: DC 15
entries: Bleakborns are also referred to as Moil zombies in some lesser-known tomes about undead, in supposed reference to the cursed city in which they first arose. They speak the Moilian language, allowing those proficient in this forgotten tongue to converse with them.

Soft and putrescent, this creature's form is wrapped in tight circles of cloth, though bloated, swollen tissue still seeps through. The odor of this creature goes beyond the stink of carrion; the putrefaction of its body is like a physical force that moves before it.

Plague blights are animated corpses of humanoids who died from plague or rot. In undeath, they seek to putrefy all that is pure. They are wily and may attempt to trick their victims into allowing themselves get close enough to touch.

entries.name: Combat
entries: In melee combat, the stench of a plague blight sickens its opponents. Far worse is its touch, which brings on a terrible wasting disease in its victims, rotting the flesh in seconds and sending tendrils of dead flesh ever inward toward the heart.

The empty orbs of this wizened corpse leak a vile, black ichor that streaks the creature's face and body, coating its clawed limbs. As the ichor runs into the creature's mouth, it bubbles and pops, so that its constant wailing emerges as a gurgling keen.

Wheeps are undead servants of more powerful unliving lords, usually serving as bodyguards but sometimes sent on missions to procure from guarded cemeteries the remains of particularly powerful and trusted figures. Their average size belies a powerful undead strength, fueled by their undying sorrow.

Eyeless, a wheep is in constant pain, sniffling and crying aloud unless it is trying to hide or move silently. From its hollow eye sockets, a wheep continuously produces a poison with the appearance of black bile. It is easy to track wheeps that have passed through an area in the last hour, because they leave behind a trail of their poisonous tears. After an hour, the bile decomposes and evaporates.
A wheep stands nearly 6 feet tall and weighs about 200 pounds.

entries.name: Combat
entries: Those close enough to hear a wheep's cries may be taken aback, but they are likely to be far more threatened by the creature's poison-coated claws and maw.

entries.name: Chaos Walkers
entries: 当一个元素被暴力摧毁时，残余物可能会升起为一名混沌行者，它试图从生者身上吸取它在生前所拥有的元素能量。
This small, salt-encrusted humanoid figure looks parched and gasping. Around it, a dry, hot breeze seems to blow from nowhere.
Desiccators are the dried-out undead remnants of creatures of elemental water. They long to quench their tremendous thirst with the precious fluids of living creatures.

Thanks to their withered forms, desiccators are sometimes mistaken for mummies, although they wear none of the wrappings common to those creatures. Cursed to remain forever bereft of the watery form it had in life, the desiccator envies and despises all living things.
Most desiccators stand about 4 feet tall but weigh only 30 to 40 pounds.

entries.name: Combat
entries: A desiccator opens combat with its Desiccating Breath, seeking to make opponents vulnerable to its Draining Touch.
This creature appears to be a formless cloud of darkness, broken only by two pinpoints of glowing red. A breeze blows toward it, as if it were drawing air into its body.
A breathstealer is an undead manifestation of elemental air. It hungers for the breath of the living.
Breathstealers vaguely resemble wraiths in their appearance, but are more amorphous and cloudlike. Still, they share the wraith's hatred for all living things.
A breathstealer fills an area roughly 5 feet on a side, with cloudlike tendrils reaching beyond that. As an incorporeal creature, a breathstealer has no weight.

entries.name: Combat
entries: A breathstealer lurks in dark places until it can sweep out and attack a living victim. Thanks to its stealth and speed, it often surprises targets.
This tall, gaunt, coal-black humanoid flickers with a blue-white flame. Its bright yellow eyes gleam with menace.
Cinderspawn are burnt-out undead remnants of creatures of elemental fire. They hate living creatures for their warmth and seek to destroy all such beings.

Like a fire elemental, a cinderspawn takes damage from and won't willingly enter a body of water. A body of water is an impassable barrier for a cinderspawn unless the creature can step or jump over it.

entries.name: Combat
entries: A cinderspawn chooses targets carefully, using its Sudden Rush action to reach vulnerable opponents that might otherwise be protected by comrades.

entries.name: Deathtritus
entries: 死灵能量的存在可以使肉体复活，但也可以赋予废弃物和残留物不死之力，形成一种死亡残渣。
These tiny, vaguely humanoid creatures are animated accumulations of tomb litter—shards of bone, lone teeth, matted hair, bits of shattered tombstone, and grave dirt.

Tomb motes sometimes spontaneously arise in graveyards with a high concentration of buried magic, undead activity, and/or mass burials. As accumulations of the animated bone, dust, hair, and flesh particles that accumulate in tombs, tomb motes are surprisingly smart and vicious.
Tomb motes weigh 5 to 8 pounds and measure no more than 1 foot in height.

entries.name: Combat
entries: Tomb motes scurry around in the shadows, trying to surprise visitors in their domain. They like to harry a single target to en masse to make up for their lack of individual strength. If a target seems threatening, they slip back into the darkness until a weaker victim comes along.
Composed of butchered flesh, rotting organs, and pungent fluids, the snakelike creature before you craves the taste of fresh meat.

Offalians are undead serpents that form when people or animals are senselessly butchered and left to rot. They are composed of the organs and bodily fluids of the slain creatures. The creatures are filled with an unquenchable hunger that drives them to attack most living creatures.

entries.name: Combat
entries: An offalian prefers to rush an opponent. The creature bites a foe, grabbing the target and keeping it held while biting it on subsequent turns. If multiple enemies approach an offalian, it hisses and releases a gout of acidic effluvia that burns and blinds would-be attackers.
Created from dirt, dust, and crushed bone, a centipedelike creature skitters rapidly across the ground towards you.

Osteopedes are undead centipedes that form from dirt and bone in places of death. They also sometimes arise from pastures where bone fragments were used as fertilizer. The creature is infused with necrotic energy, which it releases with each bite and each slash of its jagged legs.

entries.name: Combat
entries: An osteopede skitters around the battlefield, never staying in one place for long. Whenever possible, it uses its Skittering Rake to attack multiple enemies.
A pile of molten scales slithers before you, possessing the vague shape of a dragon but none of its flesh, blood, or organs.

A dragonscale slough is made of the animated flesh and scales that fall from dragons. It is common for multiple sloughs to form in the lairs of older dragons. The sloughs have many of the same attitudes and instincts of their progenitors, and they are quite hostile.

entries.name: Combat
entries: Dragonscale sloughs climb up walls and then drop down on unwary prey. Once a slough constricts a creature, it uses Suffocating Scales to silently choke the opponent. If caught or surrounded, the slough will use its Dust Breath and take advantage of the momentary blindness to retreat into hiding before striking again.

entries.name: Dread Brutes
entries: 恐怖残骸是被复活的不洁尸体或构造物，用来发挥他们的压倒性力量进行劳动、保护，或者更常见的是暴力和破坏。

Tramping out of the night is a dreadful giant corpse. For all that its eyes are lifeless and devoid of mind, the creature's gaze still promises swift death to any that it can catch and crush in its mighty grip.

Any undead army would be happy to recruit a hulking corpse. Its raw power combined with its mindless devotion to whatever master is powerful enough to command it ensures a swift victory over lesser foes. Of course, few can command a hulking corpse. Thus, these creatures are often found wandering the night, seeking only to crush, destroy, and rend.

entries.name: Combat
entries: A hulking corpse never employs subtlety or strategy. It bulls in, attempting to grab and rend its foes until they cease moving.

Preceded by the smell of carrion, this humanoid creature is formed of moist (almost muddy) earth, mixed in with small bone bits, teeth, and rotting cloth scraps, topped with a dirt-encrusted humanoid skull. Its legs are short and thick, and its chest and arms somewhat tapering.

This humanoid golem is composed of magically coherent grave earth. A grave dirt golem wears no clothing, though sometimes the clothing or the gear of past victims can be found mixed in with the medium of its form.
A grave dirt golem cannot speak or make any vocal noise. It walks and moves with a slow, clumsy gait. It weighs around 800 pounds.

entries.name: Combat
entries: No one likes to be hit by a grave dirt golem because its filth fouls the wounds of its enemies and reduces their hit point maximums. The golem can regain hit points via its Soul Rend, but once it goes berserk, no known method can re-establish control.

items: A {@creature stone golem} becomes a tombstone golem with the following substitutions. Rather than simple stone, the creature is made up of fused grave headstones, inscribed with names in various languages, often more than one name per headstone, along with birth and death dates. Second, its supernatural ability to slow opponents is replaced by the Disrupt Life ability.

entries.name: Oozes
entries: 充满了死灵能量，不死软泥是那些死于可怕命运的生物体所凝结出的黏糊糊的渗出物。
The writhing blob of ooze that approaches you reeks of death, and has a partially melted human skull suspended in its gray jelly.
Bloodrot oozes are undead jellies that form when humanoids are melted by acid. They are most commonly found around the lairs of black dragons and other creatures that employ acid to slay their foes.

entries.name: Combat
entries: A bloodrot ooze lurks in a dark corner, waiting until its prey comes close before striking. The creature then reaches out and attempts to grab a target and drain the blood from it. Bloodrots crave the blood of their foes, pursuing them without any sense of self-preservation.
A clot of animate blood the size of a small house, this amoeba of failed life is hungry to add new blood to its oozing body.

The half-congealed blood of past victims gives a blood amniote its form, and its ties to the Negative Energy Plane give the creature animation. Mindless, it seeks only to pierce the fleshy carapace of all living creatures it comes upon so it can draw out the blood beneath.

Though these creatures are mindless, vestiges of past victims completely drained of blood remain imprinted on them. Observers sometimes see these random memories as faces that briefly form on the surface of a blood amniote, only to fall away again to formlessness moments later.

entries.name: Combat
entries: When a blood amniote senses potential prey, it quickly moves to engage, hoping to draw out the blood of its victims in full quantity.

entries.name: Lore
entries: A character knows the following information with a successful check made using the {@skill Religion} skill.

entries.name: DC 15
entries: Scholars debate whether the blood amniote arises spontaneously or is crafted intentionally through necromantic rites and mass sacrifices.

entries.name: DC 20
entries: Legend has it that priests of Orcus once unleashed a storm that rained burning blood on two opposing armies. The storm slew the soldiers, and from the blood-soaked ground arose blood amniotes.

You have encountered the source of the rumbling you have been sensing: a massive, hunchbacked brute that lumbers through the cave ahead. Its limbs and body are composed of assorted bones suspended in a deep purple ooze, and what you thought was its head is actually the oversized skull of a monstrous cave dweller you have never encountered before.

Bone collectors inhabit subterranean caverns and stalk underground tunnels, killing and scavenging to collect bones to increase their mass. Three massive bone collectors, each rumored to be over 25 feet in diameter, inhabit the Underdark.

entries.name: Combat
entries: Bone collectors send out masses of tendrils to snatch opponents and drain their life. If threatened by numerous foes, it will unleash a barrage of Bone Shards upon them, knowing that it can collect the shards after the battle has been won.

Acting purely on animalistic instinct, a bone collector might flee when {@condition bloodied|LM}, boring a massive tunnel through the rock in its wake. Most bone collectors have never had to retreat, however, as most other cave dwellers are either too weak to fight it or are smart enough to leave it alone.

entries.name: Servants of Darkness
entries: 虽然大多数不死生物是出于本能或冲动行动的，但有些被创造出来是为了更高的目的，以帮助执行由某位神明、死灵术士或更聪明的不死生物制定的黑暗计划。
A repulsive, extremely tall, humanlike creature with long, rotting wings and peeling flesh, this monstrosity continually sheds rivulets of filth and decay, creating a pool of rot in which it stands.
Sometimes known as rot harbingers, these beings superficially resemble angels, but there's nothing angelic about them. Their touch causes living flesh to rot.

When a healthy creature softens, crumbles, and liquefies in death, an indefinable essence wafts away like putrid steam off stagnant beach sand. This decomposing flesh radiates an essential energy in its dissipation, and an angel of decay can extract the power resident therein.

entries.name: Combat
entries: An angel of decay prefers to wade into combat, literally, since it produces a constantly renewing pool of liquid corruption. The angel of decay excels at taking hits and giving them back, prefering to remain close to its enemies so that it may take advantage of its Rotting Aura and Feed on Decay traits.

entries.name: Lore
entries: A character knows the following information with a successful check made using the {@skill Religion} skill.

entries.name: DC 20
entries: Long ago, the gods tried to slay the demon lord Orcus while he was traveling outside the Abyss. They sent a host of angels to slay the demon lord, but Orcus ultimately prevailed, killing every last one of them. When he returned to the Abyss, the Demon Lord of Undeath created the first angels of decay as mockeries of those he'd slain and sent them to the natural world to wreak havoc on the gods' creation.

entries.name: DC 30
entries: A legion of angels of decay serve Atropus, the World Born Dead, as it wanders from planet to planet in its quest to unmake the gods' work. These angels feed off of the death and decay left in Atropus's wake, and are often found scouring the wastelands of a dead planet for scraps of essence to feed off of.

Appearing similar to a corpse that has been dug up and surgically modified, this creature stands nearly 7 feet tall, but is extraordinarily thin. Its arms are extra long, hanging nearly to mid-calf. Its head is wide and wedge-shaped, with a split mouth that opens wider than that of a normal humanoid. Its teeth glitter like shards of black, steaming ice.

Crafted in bygone days by power-mad wizards searching to create the perfect undead guardians, blasphemes still roam forgotten areas, seeking to weaken and destroy nonevil creatures with their blasphemous bite. They are most likely to be encountered near ruins of ancient cities where magic was valued more highly than personal liberty or morals. If the secret of creating or calling a blaspheme into the world still exists, it is buried in just such a location.

Each blaspheme is created with parts from multiple ancient corpses, with teeth specially harvested from sacrifices to evil powers. However, blasphemes are not hulking, slow-moving constructs; rather, they are lithe and deadly, aware of their surroundings and capable of directing their own actions.
Blasphemes stand just under 7 feet tall and weigh about 190 pounds.

entries.name: Combat
entries: A blaspheme resonates with evil power, the focus of which is concentrated in its teeth. Thus, blasphemes charge into combat in almost every situation, attempting to bite their victims as quickly as possible, so that its master or allies can take advantage of its weakening effect.
This foul humanoid wears a loose shift, but its mottled, decaying flesh is still clearly visible, drawn tightly over bones. Hairless, it has a carnivore's sharp teeth and eyes like hot coals.

Like traditional ghouls, gravetouched ghouls haunt graveyards, battlefields, and other places rich with the carrion for which they hunger. These terrible creatures lurk wherever the stench of death hangs heavy, ready to devour the unwary.

entries.name: Combat
entries: This creature attacks with surprise, attempting to paralyze a target and drag it away from its allies before they can react.

entries.name: Lore
entries: A character knows the following information with a successful check made using the {@skill Religion} skill.

entries.name: DC 10
entries: Ghouls are said to be created upon the death of a living sentient being who savored the taste of the flesh of other sentient creatures. This assertion may or may not be true, but it does explain the disgusting behavior of these anthropophagous undead.

entries.name: DC 15
entries: Some believe that anyone of exceptional debauchery and wickedness runs the risk of becoming a gravetouched ghoul. The transformation from living beings into fell creatures of the night has warped their minds, making them cunning and feral.

entries.name: DC 20
entries: While most humanoids who engage in these foul activities and return from the grave are mere ghouls, in rare occasions the creation of a ghoul briefly draws the attention of Doresain, King of the Ghouls. When this happens, the newly formed ghoul does not possess the standard statistics for a ghoul, but instead it becomes a gravetouched ghoul. These gravetouched ghouls are said to be "touched by the King."
This shrunken and disfigured humanoid carcass moves under the power of its own animation, though the details of its shape are blurred beneath a coating of filth and grave dirt.

Entombers are undead animated by necromancers who prefer to leave the dirty work to their servants. The entombers are perfect for putting bodies in the ground, or bringing them out, depending on the needs of their masters. They usually inhabit cemeteries, catacombs, or other places where many corpses might be found, dragging corpses or entire coffins behind them as they wander.

Entombers are filthy, streaked with dirt, and sometimes even bits of desiccated flesh (not their own), jewelry, and other small bits taken from the bodies they exhume or entomb. They stink of both carrion and embalming alchemical fluids. Closer scrutiny reveals their lips are sewn shut.
Most entombers are about 6 feet tall and weigh about 160 pounds.

entries.name: Combat
entries: In melee combat, an entomber's fist is a powerful weapon. However, the fear associated with entombers is more due to their ability to entomb foes with their attack. Entombers enjoy entombing unconscious foes that have no chance of fighting back, but unless specifically commanded otherwise, entombers treat all living creatures as subjects for their entombing power.

entries.name: Spirits
entries: 被黑暗情绪和束缚的死灵能量所注入，不死之灵徘徊在世界的阴暗角落和缝隙中，以一种受折磨的、阴影般存在的状态继续存在。

Two fiery green eyes glare from a shrouded, half-real visage of this vaguely humanoid shade. Either it is dressed in robes, or its ectoplasmic flesh is naturally loose and flowing. Dark symbols hang in the air just above and about its form, free-standing glyphs that viscerally demonstrate the creature's anathema to all things divine.

Quells are incorporeal creatures of malevolence and the night. They despise all living things, as well as the light that nurtures them, but the urge that truly drives them is their hatred of those who serve deities.

If they could, quells would commit deicide, though of course such actions are far beyond a quell's power. However, while a quell cannot directly affect a deity, it does have a power over the connection between a deity and its followers.
Because of their powers, quells are sought out by bands of more powerful undead or necromancers.

entries.name: Combat
entries: Quells attack directly in combat. Their true power lies in their ability to break connections between clerics and their deities.
A smiling, brightly clothed figure stands before you.

In life, a spectral lyrist used its powers of performance and persuasion to further the cause of evil and strife, whether by urging listeners to commit violence or simply luring the innocent to their deaths. Cursed to forever walk the earth, it blames those still alive for its undead state and seeks to commit even greater evils against them.

A spectral lyrist can appear as any Medium humanoid, and it doesn't share the insubstantial or diaphanous appearance of other incorporeal creatures when so disguised. A lyrist is weightless, regardless of appearance.

entries.name: Combat
entries: A spectral lyrist uses its ability to bluff and change its appearance to present itself as a friendly creature, putting victims at ease until it can use its spells on them.

A lone, wavering figure begins a song. The haunting melody echoes through the air, calling for you to dance. The music makes your soul shrivel, but it also makes you smile. How can something be so awful and so wonderful at the same time?

A crypt chanter's voice is the perfect horror, at once compelling and dreadful. These undead creatures sometimes appear to be playing spectral violas, flutes, drums, or any other instruments they choose, varying from chanter to chanter.

entries.name: Combat
entries: A crypt chanter's strength and shield is its music. A crypt chanter seeks to snare its victims with its music, and then drain them of life with the same melody. If threatened, a crypt chanter retreats into a nearby wall or other handy physical barrier.

A mighty river of fog streams forward like an evil waterfall, swollen with storm and spray. Accompanying the shape is a susurrus of dreamlike voices that murmur, cry, and rail against some terrible fate. Slender tendrils of mist extend from the mass, patting and feeling for sustenance.

A dream vestige is a hunter; it hunts for other creatures to incorporate into itself—mind and body, living or undead. Thus, even the undying have cause to fear a dream vestige, which preys on its own. It stalks prey on rooftops, behind walls, or under floors, unseen by its victims. A sudden visceral dread heralds the creature's arrival, at which time the whispers, moans, and lamenting of its subsumed victims becomes audibly apparent.

entries.name: Combat
entries: A dream vestige uses every ability it has at its disposal to disrupt and crumble the minds and bodies of the living, seeking to draw ever more creatures into itself.

entries.name: Lore
entries: A character knows the following information with a successful check made using the {@skill History} or {@skill Religion} skill.

entries.name: DC 15
entries: The original dream vestige was born from the nightmares of an entire city, as all of its citizens died in cursed sleep (a curse that some attribute to Orcus). Since then, that creature has spawned itself many times over.

entries.name: Undead Aviary
entries: 大多数不死生物都是地面生物，但有一些可以飞向天空，在空中传播腐化和死亡。
A knot of flaccidly flapping membranes kites through the air, now drifting with the currents, now stooping swiftly through the air toward you.

Skin kites are undead creatures made up of the stolen skin of past victims. They feed on the skin of living beings, replenishing their own constantly rotting skin, as well as using new skin as spawning material for new skin kites.

No two skin kites appear the same. They display a range of different colors, depending on the creatures from which they were harvested. Many skin kites have rotting clumps of hair or fur, unintended additional trophies from past victims.
A skin kite has no body, only a wingspan, which is about 5 feet. It weighs about 5 pounds.

entries.name: Combat
entries: A skin kite attacks by landing on a victim and melding a portion of its undead membrane with its victim's skin. After using Meld to absorb a target's skin, the skin kite attempts to Disengage and retreat to a safe location where it can use Launch Kite without provoking opportunity attacks.

A faint whirring sound and the stench of death precedes a great shape scudding through the air. The creature has a humanoid form with the skull of a long-toothed bull. Its upper arms are great wings, and its lower legs end in cruel, clawed talons. No skin or fur can be seen beneath the dingy gray funerary wrappings that cover the entire creature like a mummy.

Skirrs are predators that hunt the edges of necropolises, great expanses of deadly swamps, deserts, or other places where victims might be found alone, hurt, and pressed by dangers from directions other than the sky. That's when skirrs swoop in to attack.
Skirrs measure, wingtip-to-wingtip, 30 feet or more, and weigh about 20,000 pounds.

entries.name: Combat
entries: Skirrs are predators that scavenge the bodies of those killed by sudden stops. Their favored tactic is to swoop down, grab a victim, ascend to a height of at least 200 feet, and then drop the victim in a deadly fall.

From the skies descends not a bird nor winged beast, but a floating brain with its spine still attached. Crackling with black lightning, you hear a foul cackle echo through your mind as your muscles begin to twitch under a will that is not your own.

Made sentient through foul magic, a paralyth is the animated spine and brain of a humanoid. Instead of being put in a jar, the brain is given the power of flight and can emit waves of electricity from its spinal cord. The brain is empowered with potent psionic abilities, allowing the paralyth to enslave weak-minded creatures that can enact its dark will.

entries.name: Combat
entries: Paralyths have a strong sense of self-preservation, which makes them pause at the edge of combat. They prefer to let their enslaved minions do the dirty work, but may swoop in when the opportunity arises to unleash a blast of its Nervous Feedback.

entries.name: Lore
entries: A character knows the following information with a successful check made using the {@skill Arcana} skill.

entries.name: DC 15
entries: Paralyths are created when necromancers extract the brains and spines from recent victims. However, sometimes a paralyth is created from the necromancer itself in an attempt to preserve their sharp minds even in death.

entries.name: DC 20
entries: A few cunning paralyths will encase themselves within the body of a construct, granting them physical protection and the use of the construct's limbs at the cost of their flight capabilities.

entries.name: Unrisen
entries: 魔法出现失误时，当魔法是{@spell raise dead}或类似的复活咒语时，结果可能会很严重。这个咒语可能看起来完全失败，然而残留的能量有时会在初始尝试后几天内使生物复活。当这种情况发生时，被复活的对象会以其灵魂分裂和堕落的状态出现。一只宠物死而复生，但它不再是家人曾经认识的可爱猫咪。一个孩子回来了，但它却邪恶且堕落，对曾经爱过的人毫不在乎。无论生物在前世中采取何种形态，它都会以邪恶、扭曲的形态回归——它会以未复活者的形式回归。
一个角色通过使用{@skill Arcana}或{@skill Religion}技能成功检查后获得以下信息。

entries.name: DC 15
entries: 未升者是试图复活野兽或人形生物失败的腐化结果。在失败的仪式之后，生物被埋葬一段时间后，它会起身向附近的活物复仇，认为它们是导致自己死亡的罪魁祸首。未升者最常见的类型是儿童、宠物、坐骑以及社区中显赫的人物，如市长或牧师。这些人或生物死后备受惋惜，因此它们的同伴常常不惜一切尝试复活它们。

entries.name: DC 18
entries: 未升起者被彼此吸引，并能感知到同类的存在。他们有时会环游世界，寻找其他同类，组成邪恶的团体。

entries.name: DC 21
entries: 大多数未复活者都非常聪明。他们假装正常，有时会潜入他们以前的生活中，说服他们的朋友和家人复活仪式成功地起作用。

The dog before you appears not as a friendly companion, but as a rabid beast that seeks to maim and kill anything that gets near it. With sickly yellow flesh made bare by missing chunks of fur, it is a wonder that this animal is alive at all.

A vile pet acts much like a living beast infected with rabies, and is characterized by uncurable pestilence of the flesh. Any poor soul that attempts to calm it down will be met with a filthy bite that leaves it hungrier by the day until it can no longer sustain itself.

entries.name: Combat
entries: Vile pets tend to run in packs, overrunning commoners in attempt to spread disease. They try to flank a target and use their Filthy Bites. However, the creatures are cowardly and flee if faced with a threatening adversary.
This pale creature resembles a human child with slug-white skin. Its black eyes are too knowing for their size, and its too-wide mouth is home to rot and ruin.

When a guardian's betrayal, either outright or through negligence, leads to the death of a child, a resurrection spell or even pure chance may cause its corpse to rise as a slaymate. A slaymate's appearance is a weird and twisted reflection of the form it had in life.

Slaymates are highly prized by necromancers, and thus are rarely encountered alone, but instead are found in the presence of evil spellcasters and others who dabble in necromancy. Many a slaymate can be found riding, papoose style, on the back of a necromancer who values the slaymate's special abilities.
A slaymate is about the height and weight of an eight-year-old human child.

entries.name: Combat
entries: Slaymates prefer to attack from the shadows, preferably on the back of a necromancer guardian if it has one. When forced to fight, the slaymate prefers to use its disease-laden bite, or a small knife if provided with one.

The once-friendly priest slips out a wicked grin, their jagged teeth possessing a ghoulish yellow tint, presenting a stark contrast to the warm smile you were once familiar with. Black staff in hand, the priest mutters a prayer in a language you don't understand and prepares to defend their church from the interlopers before them.

When a cleric's resurrection goes wrong, a dark god might spot a chance to intervene, corrupting their connection to the divine so that the newly formed tainted priest may serve their religion instead. With a false aura that prevents their fellow holy men from detecting their true nature, a tainted priest will slowly corrupt their former church into a blasphemous mockery of what it once was.

If given enough time to amass an undead army and to corrupt their once-innocent followers into servants of evil, a tainted priest will attempt to destroy their church and the settlement surrounding it. They will then pose as a refugee of this terrible tragedy and flee to another church of their original faith, rising the ranks and starting the infection process again. A tainted priest may even seek to purposefully create other unrisen, taking advantage of "unfortunate accidents" that kill innocent children or pets and altering their own resurrection magic to ensure that the victim rises as another of their kind.

entries.name: Combat
entries: A tainted priest prefers to remain at a distance, using its ranged spells as much as possible. If approached in melee, the creature uses vile eruption to weaken its opponent and then escape. Otherwise, the priest whacks the foe with its staff, gaining hit points before retreating.

entries.name: Wraiths
entries: 幽灵憎恨生者，并试图通过杀死他们遇到的凡人来创造更多同类。他们是居住在黑暗中的无欢乐生物。

The howling that interrupted your sleep grows louder and louder, but you hear no disturbances amongst the trees around you. Then, from the corner of your eye, you see a distortion in the light of the moon shining down on you. Looking closer, you see a translucent werewolf floating above you, its shadowy claws twitching in anticipation for blood to be spilled.
Moon wraiths are spectral apparitions that are created when a lycanthrope dies during its transformation. They are strongest under moonlight or starlight.

entries.name: Combat
entries: Moon wraiths use hit-and-run tactics, flying though enemies with Umbral Dash as often as possible. If {@condition bloodied|LM}, they retreat and regenerate as many hit points as possible before diving back into the fray.

Just as the bride finishes saying her vows, a hooded figure drops down from the ceiling, plunging a sword into her back and out the other side. The audience shrieks in horror as blood drips from the wound, staining her once perfect white dress. As she takes her last exhale, a shadowy spirit emerges from her mouth and takes form above the stage. The spirit shrieks in anguish and malice, surprising the assassin and wedding-goers alike, and prepares to exact revenge upon the unwary killer that ruined her wedding.

An oblivion wraith is a large, shadowy rip in reality that absorbs light and distorts its surroundings. It is created when a person dies violently during an important life event, such as a wedding or a coronation.

entries.name: Combat
entries: The oblivion wraith seeks to share its suffering with as many creatures as possible via Obliviate. If attacked, it teleports away using Shadow Glide and unleashes Nihil Blasts upon the interloper getting in the way of its twisted, hateful vengeance. If {@condition bloodied|LM}, the wraith isn't above fleeing and regaining its strength so that it may destroy the living another day.

You see the townsfolk fleeing en masse and letting out shrieks of horror. Turning the corner, you see that the shrieks come not just from the innocent civilians, but from the vortex of blackened souls swirling through the street. Between their cries you can hear pleas for help from these spirits, even as the civilians they grasp at wither away and join their ranks.

A vortex wraith is an amalgamation of souls killed simultaneously through violent means. Unaware of its death, the vortex wraith begs for help from any living creature it encounters, clinging onto it for help until it withers away and joins the vortex as another oblivious victim.

entries.name: Combat
entries: The vortex wraith seeks out the nearest living creatures for assistance, using Grasp for Help, Fearful Embrace, and Desperate Plea to bring them closer and keep them there. Once attacked, the wraith will become afraid and use Summon Aid to defend itself, but will still seek to embrace the attacker as normal. If {@condition bloodied|LM} or exposed to light, the wraith will flee as best it can, but not without using its abilities on the civilians it passes along the way.

entries.name: Ghost Brute
entries: 幽灵蛮兽是动物、魔法兽、有智慧但不足以成为普通幽灵的植物以及其他生物的幽灵残留。它们漫无目的地漂浮，萦绕在死亡的地方，发出无尽的哀鸣。
幽灵蛮人通常是由导致其地球伴侣或主人死后留下的相同情况导致的。它可能是一个被背叛的圣武士的坐骑，一个悲剧性被杀的孩子心爱的宠物，一个幽灵树精的烧焦橡树，或者是一个被谋杀的德鲁伊的动物伴侣。在大多数情况下，安葬相关的生物也会结束幽灵蛮人的存在。
然而，有时候奇怪的情况可能会产生一个没有智能伴侣的幽灵残暴体。例如，一个突然被邪恶魔法攻击摧毁的森林可能会保留为一个幽灵树林，里面居住着仍然存在的灵魂，甚至完全意识不到自己的毁灭。

entries.name: In Your Campaign
entries: 除了为聪明的幽灵服务外，幽灵蛮兵也很适合作为死灵术士和邪恶邪教徒的同伴。蛮兵的非实体本质使其能够轻松守卫封闭空间，并且无需其主人保持其生存或维护其尸体。成为幽灵蛮兵的猫头鹰和其他鸟类对于那些不惧与不死之物交往的人来说也是非常有效的熟人。
在罕见的情况下，一群(ghost brutes)可能会恐吓一个或两个小聚居地。在一个小区域内高浓度的不死之灵可能会吸引邪恶势力的注意，他们可能会利用这一点来谋取利益，这正是尽快处理这种威胁的更多原因。

entries.name: Ghost Brute Template
entries: 只有一只未对齐的野兽或植物才能成为一个幽灵蛮兽，尽管DM可能会允许其他对齐的生物适当地成为幽灵蛮兽。当一个活物（称为基础生物）被转化为幽灵蛮兽时，它保留其统计数据，除非另有说明。

entries.name: Type
entries: 幽灵蛮人是一种不死生物，它不需要空气、食物、饮料或睡眠。

entries.name: Armor Class
entries: 幽灵蛮人的护甲等级变为10 +其敏捷修正值（Dexterity modifier）（如果尚未达到此值），并且失去了天然护甲或其他任何可能拥有的护甲来源。

entries.name: Speed
entries: 幽灵蛮人的步行速度设定为0，失去其他所有形式的移动。然后它获得了40英尺的魔法飞行速度，并且可以悬浮。(Ghost Brute)

entries.name: Ability Score Adjustment
entries: 幽灵蛮人的魅力分数设定为其力量或敏捷分数中较高的那个。然后将其力量分数减半，最低为1。

entries.name: Damage Vulnerabilities, Resistances, and Immunities
entries: 幽灵蛮族拥有与{@creature ghost}相同的弱点、抗性和免疫力。基础生物的任何弱点、抗性或免疫力都不会被保留。

entries.name: Condition Immunities
entries: 这个幽灵蛮人无法被魅惑、惊吓、缠斗、麻痹、石化、中毒、倒地或者束缚。它也不会受到疲劳的影响。

entries.name: Senses
entries: 幽灵蛮兽获得60英尺的暗视力。如果基础生物已经拥有暗视力，则其暗视范围将增加60英尺。但是，如果基础生物具有致盲视觉并且在其范围之外是盲目的，那么幽灵蛮兽将不会获得暗视力。

entries.name: Traits, Actions, and Proficiencies
entries: 幽灵蛮兵失去任何假定有生理的特质，比如水陆两栖，以及依赖实体形态的特质，比如蜘蛛攀爬或站跳。幽灵蛮兵可能会保留或失去其巢穴行动中的任何一个或全部，或者根据DM的判断获得新的。它还会根据下面的部分描述获得额外的行动和特质。否则，幽灵蛮兵保留基础生物的熟练项、行动和特质。

entries.name: Additional Traits
entries: 幽灵蛮人获得以下特性。

entries.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: 幽灵蛮人在物质位面时可以看到60英尺的虚实位面，反之亦然。

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: 幽灵蛮人可以像通过艰难地形一样穿过其他生物和物体。如果它在物体内结束回合，会受到5(1d10)点力场伤害。

entries.name: Withering Touch
entries: 幽灵蛮人的攻击造成死灵伤害，而不是它们正常的伤害类型。

entries.name: Additional Abilities
entries: 幽灵蛮人获得以下行动选项。

entries.name: Etherealness
entries: 幽灵蛮人从物质位面进入虚空位面，反之亦然。它在边界虚空中对物质位面可见，反之亦然，但它无法影响或受到另一位面上的任何事物的影响。

entries.name: Bloodcurling Howl (Recharge 6)
entries: 幽灵残暴者(mournful howling of the ghost brute)的哀怨嚎叫让活着的人感到彻骨寒冷。在距离幽灵残暴者30英尺内且能听到它的每个生物必须进行一次感知豁免检定（豁免 DC 8 + 幽灵残暴者的熟练加值 + 它的魅力调整值），否则会受到1分钟的惊恐效果（持续豁免）。如果目标的豁免成功或效果结束，目标将对这个幽灵残暴者的血腥嚎叫(Bloodcurling Howl)在接下来的24小时内免疫。

entries.name: Half-Vampire
entries: 在罕见情况下，一个最近摄入大量血液的吸血鬼会获得与人类成功繁殖的能力，创造出半吸血鬼的后代。同样，在怀孕的人类勉强幸存于吸血鬼的咬击攻击的异常情况下，孩子可能会因攻击者的吸血鬼主义而"受污染"。无论起源如何，这类事件产生的孩子通常被视为被排斥者，既不受活人欢迎也不受不死者欢迎。
半吸血鬼被吸引到其他生物，并且在城镇或城市中生活时感觉更舒适。然而，半吸血鬼知道他们必须保持身份的秘密，否则就会面临他人的仇恨和暴力。
半吸血鬼通常外貌吸引人且口才出众。他们的皮肤苍白，甚至呈灰色。
与他们的不死族祖先不同，半吸血鬼们享有追求任何属性（或诅咒）的自由，尽管大多数倾向于中立或邪恶。那些罕见的善良半吸血鬼常常感到被他们的血统所困扰，有时会努力消除祖先的邪恶。

entries.name: In Your Campaign
entries: 作为类人生物，半吸血鬼可以像其他任何智能生物类型一样多样化和有趣。大多数最终成为全血统吸血鬼的仆人，但也有一些可能选择反抗他们的血统，并追捕他们的不死同胞为了更伟大的利益。
大多数显著的半吸血鬼会保守他们的血统秘密，揭露这一点可能会成为你战役中的一个巨大转折或情节点。与此同时，那些公开拥抱他们血统的半吸血鬼通常会因为他们的魅惑能力、天生的魅力本质或两者兼具而成为普通人类中的领袖和军阀，无论是由于他们的魅惑能力、天生的魅力本质，还是两者兼具。

entries.name: Half-Vampire Template
entries: 只有人形生物才能作为半吸血鬼诞生，尽管DM可能会允许其他类型的生物适当地成为半吸血鬼。当一个活物（被称为基础生物）作为半吸血鬼诞生时，除下文所述外，它保留其属性。

entries.name: Ability Score Adjustment
entries: 这位半吸血鬼的魅力分数增加了2点，最高为22分。

entries.name: Damage Resistances
entries: 半吸血鬼获得对死灵伤害的抗性。

entries.name: Senses
entries: 半吸血鬼获得{@sense darkvision}直至60英尺的暗视能力。如果基础生物已经拥有暗视能力，则其暗视半径将增加60英尺。然而，如果基础生物具有致盲视觉并且在其半径之外是盲目的，那么半吸血鬼将不会获得暗视能力。

entries.name: Additional Traits
entries: 半吸血鬼获得以下特征。

entries.name: Regeneration
entries: 半吸血鬼在其回合开始时恢复10点生命值，如果它至少有1点生命值且不处于阳光下。如果半吸血鬼受到辐射伤害，则此特性在半吸血鬼的下一个回合开始时不起作用。

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: 在阳光下，半吸血鬼在进行攻击检定时有劣势，以及在依赖视觉的感知（(Perception)）检定中也有劣势。

entries.name: Additional Abilities
entries: 半吸血鬼获得以下行动选项。

entries.name: Multiattack
entries: 这位半吸血鬼进行两次爪击。它可以用其中一次攻击来进行一次咬击。

entries.name: Bite
entries: 如果基础生物已经有一项咬击动作，半吸血鬼可以保留它。否则，这次攻击使用半吸血鬼的力量调整值来确定其攻击加值和伤害。这次攻击对被半吸血鬼制服的一个目标造成穿刺伤害，{@condition incapacitated}，或者{@condition restrained}。攻击的伤害骰数等于半吸血鬼的一个生命骰。
目标还会受到半吸血鬼的两个骰子的一半的死灵伤害。目标遭受的生命流失等同于所受的死灵伤害，而吸血鬼则会回复相同数量的生命值。

entries.name: Claws
entries: 如果基础生物已经有一项爪击（Claw）或多次爪击（Claws）动作，半吸血鬼可以保留它。否则，这次攻击使用半吸血鬼的力量调整值来确定其攻击加值和伤害。这次攻击对一个目标造成挥砍伤害，其伤害骰数等于半吸血鬼的一个生命骰。半吸血鬼可以选择不造成伤害，而是{@condition grappled|PHB|grapple}目标（逃脱豁免 DC 10 + 半吸血鬼的力量调整值）。

entries.name: Charm
entries: 这位半吸血鬼选择一个在它能看见的30英尺内的人形生物作为目标。如果目标能看见这位半吸血鬼，目标必须通过一次感知豁免检定（豁免 DC 8 + 半吸血鬼的熟练加值 + 它的魅力调整值）来抵抗这个魔法，否则将被半吸血鬼 {@condition charmed}。被魅惑的目标将把半吸血鬼视为一个可信赖的朋友，应该被听从和保护。尽管目标并不受半吸血鬼的控制，但它会以最有利的方式接受半吸血鬼的请求或行动。
如果半吸血鬼或半吸血鬼的同伴对目标造成任何伤害，效果就会结束。否则，效果持续8小时，或者直到半吸血鬼被摧毁、处于与目标不同的存在平面上，或者采取一个奖励动作来结束效果。
The hyena-headed figure standing before you has a particularly feral appearance, its muscular hands clenched tightly around a glaive.

items.name: Combat
entries: The half-vampire gnoll pack lord acts mostly as a normal pack lord would. It isn't smarter or physically stronger than the average pack lord, but the martial prowess being a half-vampire grants alongside the ability to charm other gnolls allows a half-vampire gnoll pack lord to lead its pack more strictly and effectively than the typical pack lord ever could.

entries.name: Hooded Pupil
entries: 一个戴着兜帽的学徒是一个被死灵魔法的诱惑所吸引的人形生物或巨人，他们嫉妒死灵术士所掌握的力量以及吸血鬼所享有的永生，但又不愿放弃生命。
戴兜帽的学生通常会在与更强大的智能不死生物进行"学徒期"中被发现。不死生物大师有时需要活人仆人来推动其在生者社会中的目的。另一方面，活着的学生亲眼见证了完全拥抱黑暗的含义。
当一个强大的不死生物将死灵术的秘密传授给接受其真理的人时，通常会形成带兜帽的学徒。作为他们学徒身份的证明，带兜帽的学徒经常穿着一种带有不祥兜帽的斗篷。

entries.name: In Your Campaign
entries: 作为聪明不死生物的学徒，戴着兜帽的瞳生通常会紧随其主人，观察他们进行实验或推进计划。偶尔，一个戴着兜帽的瞳生可能会被派出去获得一些现实世界的经验，或者执行其主人计划的关键阶段。如果冒险小组在这样的阶段遇到了瞳生，瞳生很可能会试图撤退并通知其主人这个威胁。
有时候，一个戴兜帽的学徒可能会因为其主人的毁灭或不可用性而独自行动。像这样的孤儿学徒利用他们学到的技能成为邪教和其他组织的领袖，这些组织为他们的主人的利益服务，无论主人是已故的还是其他情况。

entries.name: Hooded Pupil Template
entries: 只有人形生物或巨人才能成为一个(被兜帽掩盖的学徒) (hooded pupil)，尽管DM可能会允许其他类型的生物适当地成为(被兜帽掩盖的学徒) (hooded pupil)。当一个活物（称为基础生物）成为一个(被兜帽掩盖的学徒) (hooded pupil) 时，它保留其统计数据，除非以下所述。

entries.name: Ability Score Adjustment
entries: 被戴兜帽的学生的魅力属性提高了2点，最高为22，最低为14。

entries.name: Armor Class
entries: 带兜帽瞳孔的外层皮肤变厚，形成一层全覆盖的黄色老茧，为带兜帽瞳孔提供天然护甲，并使其AC值增加(+2)。

entries.name: Hit Dice
entries: 带兜帽的学生获得了额外3个命中骰，这将增加其最大生命值。

entries.name: Speed
entries: 带兜帽的学生获得了一个魔法飞行速度，为20英尺。

entries.name: Skills
entries: 带兜帽的学生在奥术学和宗教方面获得熟练度。

entries.name: Damage Vulnerabilities, Resistances, and Immunities
entries: 带兜帽的瞳生获得对冷和死灵伤害的抗性。

entries.name: Undying Nature
entries: 这只戴兜帽的瞳生物可以无限期地屏住呼吸，不需要食物、水或睡眠。它也不会受到{@condition exhaustion|PHB}的影响。

entries.name: Additional Traits
entries: 戴兜帽的学生获得以下特征。

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: 这位戴兜帽的学徒选择了四个死灵法术：一个零级法术，一个1级法术，一个2级或3级法术，以及一个3级或4级法术。它可以随意施放前两个法术，每天可以施放第三个法术两次，第四个法术一次。对于这些法术，魅力是这位戴兜帽学徒的固有施法能力。

entries.name: Unholy Weapons
entries: 带兜帽的学徒的武器攻击是魔法的。当带兜帽的学徒用任何武器命中时，武器额外造成2d6点死灵伤害。

entries.name: Additional Abilities
entries: 戴着兜帽的学生获得以下其中一个奖励动作选项。

entries.name: Create Undead
entries: 带兜帽的学徒在距离它30英尺的未被占据的空间中魔法召唤一个骷髅或僵尸。以这种方式召唤的不死生物将在相同的先攻值上行动，并尽力按照带兜帽的学徒的命令行动。带兜帽的学徒可以通过这种能力同时召唤最多五个不死生物，而通过这种能力召唤的任何不死生物在1分钟后会化为尘土。

entries.name: Drink Blood (Recharge 5-6)
entries: 带兜帽的瞳生物可以吸取或饮取其触及范围内生物的伤口中的血液，前提是该生物未达到全部生命值。该生物必须是自愿的、被带兜帽的瞳生物或其盟友所控制、无能力行动，或者被限制行动。投掷一个d6的骰子，次数等于基础生物的挑战等级。目标将受到死灵伤害并遭受等同于总和的生命流失，而带兜帽的瞳生物将回复等同于所造成伤害的生命值。

entries.name: Shadow Form (Recharge 4-6)
entries: 带兜帽的瞳生变幻成一团黑暗的无定形物，直到回合结束。在此期间，带兜帽的瞳生对所有伤害免疫，不能被抓住、石化、击倒、束缚或眩晕。带兜帽的瞳生所穿戴或携带的装备仍然在其所有权下。

entries.name: Weakening Burst (Recharge 5-6)
entries: 带兜帽的学生释放出一阵负能量。投掷一个d6，次数等于基础生物的挑战等级的一半。每个距离学生30英尺内的生物会受到等于所有d6的总和的死灵伤害（成功通过体质豁免则减半，豁免 DC 为 8 + 带兜帽学生的熟练加值 + 它的魅力调整值）。如果豁免失败超过5点，目标还不能恢复生命值，并且其速度减半，直到带兜帽学生的下一个回合结束。
A smell like an open grave heralds this hulking figure. It is draped in ominous black folds, its features lost beneath a night-dark hood wide enough to conceal more than a single head.

items.name: Combat
entries: A hooded pupil ettin relishes its heightened abilities in combat, usually beginning any conflict by using the {@spell bestow curse} spell on the strongest looking enemy. Once threats are dealt with, it attempts to drink the blood of any smaller enemy it can grapple.

entries.name: Mummified Creature
entries: 木乃伊是不死生物，使用古代死灵魔法进行防腐。通常被设置为守护神圣遗址的守卫，木乃伊会保护它们的职责直到被摧毁。如果木乃伊因任何原因无法保护它的职责，它将变成一个无法理智的复仇之灵，追捕那些亵渎了它被指定保卫的遗址的人。
一具木乃伊看起来枯瘦干燥，其特征被藏在几个世纪前的葬礼包裹之下。它以缓慢、拖沓的步态移动，并因岁月的沉重而呻吟。它曾经侍奉的神明的象征常常标记着这些可怕的生物。虽然其他不死生物散发着腐肉的恶臭，但用来制造木乃伊的草药和粉末散发出一种尖锐、刺鼻的气味，就像香料柜中的气味。

entries.name: In Your Campaign
entries: 木乃伊可以作为各种情况下的基本敌人类型。智力分数为7或更低的木乃伊通常被用作智能不死生物的仆人，或最终成为你的队伍处理的简单食物。木乃伊的具体目的最终取决于其保存背后的原因，但所有木乃伊化生物在可能的情况下都遵循其创造者制定的具体指令。
当一具木乃伊生物的智力得分达到8或更高时，通常会利用其心智设施来领导其他木乃伊，以更有效地执行它们主人的指令。有时，一个异常聪明的木乃伊可以摆脱它守护的地点，成为一股强大的邪恶力量（见下面的侧边栏）.

entries.name: Mummified Creature Template
entries: 只有巨大或更小的巨人、人形生物或畸变生物可以成为木乃伊生物，尽管DM可能允许其他类型的生物适当地被木乃伊化。当一个活物（称为基础生物）被转化为木乃伊时，它保留其统计数据，除非另有说明。

entries.name: Type
entries: 木乃伊是一种不死生物，它不需要空气、食物、饮料或睡眠。

entries.name: Armor Class
entries: 如果尚未如此，木乃伊的护甲等级变为10 +其敏捷调整值，并且失去天然护甲或其他任何可能具有的护甲来源。

entries.name: Hit Dice
entries: 木乃伊获得了3个额外的命中骰，这将增加其最大生命值。

entries.name: Speed
entries: 木乃伊的速度减少了10英尺。

entries.name: Ability Score Adjustment
entries: 木乃伊的力量和魅力分数各增加2点，最高为22，最低为13。它的敏捷和智力分数各减少2点，最低为4。

entries.name: Damage Vulnerabilities, Resistances, and Immunities
entries: 木乃伊获得对非魔法攻击造成的钝击、穿刺和挥砍伤害的抗性。木乃伊对死灵和毒素伤害免疫，并对火焰伤害有易受性。基础生物的任何易受性、抗性或免疫都不被保留。

entries.name: Condition Immunities
entries: 这个木乃伊不能是{@condition charmed|PHB}、{@condition frightened|PHB}、{@condition paralyzed|PHB}或{@condition poisoned|PHB}。它也不会受到{@condition exhaustion|PHB}的影响。

entries.name: Senses
entries: 木乃伊获得{@sense darkvision}直至60英尺。如果基础生物已经拥有暗视能力，其暗视半径将增加60英尺。然而，如果基础生物具有致盲视觉并且在其半径之外是盲目的，木乃伊将不会获得暗视。

entries.name: Traits, Actions, and Proficiencies
entries: 木乃伊失去任何假定为生物生理的特征，比如水生（Amphibious）。木乃伊可能会保留或失去其巢穴动作中的任何一个或全部，或根据DM的判断获得新的动作。它还会根据下面的部分描述获得额外的动作和特征。否则，木乃伊会保留基础生物的熟练项、动作和特征。

entries.name: Additional Traits
entries: 木乃伊获得以下特质。

entries.name: Mummy Rot
entries: 当木乃伊用自然武器（例如爪、拳头、触须或蹄攻击）对生物进行近战攻击时，攻击额外造成10（3d6）点死灵伤害，并且目标必须通过一次体质豁免才能避免被木乃伊腐烂所诅咒（豁免 DC 为 8 + 木乃伊的熟练加值 + 其体质调整值）。被诅咒的目标无法恢复生命值，其生命值上限每过 24 小时减少10（3d6）点。如果诅咒将目标的生命值上限降低到 0，目标将死亡，其身体变成尘土。诅咒会持续，直到被{@i remove curse}法术或类似魔法移除。

entries.name: Additional Abilities
entries: 木乃伊获得以下行动选项。

entries.name: Multiattack
entries: 如果基础生物已经具有多重攻击动作，它可以保留；此外，木乃伊可以放弃每轮一次攻击来使用可怕凝视。否则，木乃伊可以使用它的可怕凝视并用腐烂之拳进行一次攻击。

entries.name: Fist
entries: 如果基础生物已经具有使用自然武器进行的近战攻击（例如爪子、拳头、触须或蹄攻击），则它不会获得此动作。否则，此攻击使用木乃伊的力量调整值来确定其攻击加值和伤害。此攻击对一个目标造成钝击伤害，其伤害骰数等于木乃伊的生命骰数量的两倍。

entries.name: Dreadful Glare
entries: 木乃伊选择一个在其视线范围内的生物，距离不超过60英尺。如果目标能看见木乃伊，它必须通过一次感知豁免检定（豁免 DC 8 + 木乃伊的熟练加值 + 其魅力调整值）来抵抗这个魔法，否则在木乃伊的下一个回合结束前，它将被{@condition frightened|PHB}。如果目标的豁免检定失败值超过5，它还将被{@condition paralyzed|PHB}，持续相同的时间。成功通过豁免检定的目标在接下来的24小时内对所有木乃伊（但不包括木乃伊领主）的可怖凝视免疫。

entries.name: From Free Mummy to Mummmy Lord
entries: 当一个聪明的木乃伊挣脱了它守护的神庙或陵墓，它就成为了一个自由木乃伊，可以自由地在任何地方游荡。由于大多数木乃伊和木乃伊领主的威胁局限于他们被埋葬的地点，大多数组织都没有准备好应对自由木乃伊及其创建的任何军队的崛起。因此，即使是最敌对的组织也会发现自己不得不搁置分歧，如果这意味着自由木乃伊会尽快被摧毁的话。
当一具自由的木乃伊首次出现时，它最有可能的行动是寻找方法晋升为木乃伊领主状态。假设它保存的心脏随时间消失，其他器官也不在了，一具自由的木乃伊将寻找合适的材料制作一个人造心脏。然后它会寻找或者重新激活一个能够用魔法将木乃伊与新心脏绑定的祭司。
然而，这个过程往往是不完美的，需要新创建的木乃伊领主通过定期的人类祭品来维持其心脏，就像一名巫妖所需的那样。祭品的频率随着时间的推移而增加，很快木乃伊领主发现自己正在组建军队，试图在绝望的努力中屠杀一个又一个定居点，以抓住其最后残存的不死之力。

A large figure covered in funeral wrappings appears before you. Large gaps between the wrappings reveals its severe lack of flesh, and the decayed state of its bones makes it clear that this being has been dead for a long time. The creature's wrappings and deterioration make it hard to identify, but its gait and loud roar are definitively those of an enraged ogre.

items.name: Combat
entries: In melee combat, a mummified ogre delivers a powerful blow. Even if it had no other abilities, its great strength and grim determination would make it a formidable opponent.

entries.name: Necromental
entries: 一只死灵元素体是元素生物的不死残骸。它只保留了元素生物生前的一小部分自我意识，但变得扭曲和邪恶。

entries.name: In Your Campaign
entries: 死灵元素生物对于专精于降咒和死灵魔法的法师来说是极好的仆从。它们也可以作为敌人出现在元素混沌(`Elemental Chaos`)或其他存在平面上，那些地方人形不死生物并不那么常见。
尽管普通元素生物不会对它们有任何不同的对待，但聪明的元素生物和原初生物对死灵元素怀有极大的蔑视，并会一见到它们就发动攻击。

entries.name: Necromental Template
entries: 只有元素生物才能成为死灵元素 (necromental)。当一个元素生物（被称为基础生物）被转化为死灵元素时，它保留其统计数据，除非另有说明。

entries.name: Type
entries: 死灵元素(Necromental)是一种不死生物，它不需要空气、食物、饮料或睡眠。

entries.name: Armor Class
entries: 亡灵元素师的护甲等级变为10 +其敏捷调整值（Dexterity modifier）（如果尚未达到），并且失去自然护甲或其他任何可能拥有的护甲来源。

entries.name: Hit Dice
entries: 死灵元素(Necromental)获得了3个额外的命中骰(hit dice)，这将增加它的最大生命值。

entries.name: Ability Score Adjustment
entries: 死灵元素师的智力和魅力分数都减半，最低为1。

entries.name: Damage Immunities
entries: 死灵元素体获得对死亡和毒素伤害的免疫能力。

entries.name: Condition Immunities
entries: 死灵元素 (necromental) 不能处于 {@condition poisoned|PHB} 或无意识状态。它也不会受到 {@condition exhaustion|PHB} 的影响。

entries.name: Senses
entries: 死灵元素体获得{@sense darkvision}尺的视野范围。如果基础生物已经拥有暗视力，其暗视范围的半径将增加60英尺。然而，如果基础生物具有致盲视觉并且在其范围之外是盲目的，死灵元素体不会获得暗视力。

entries.name: Additional Traits
entries: 死灵元素使者获得以下特质。

entries.name: Create Spawn
entries: 元素被死亡的死灵元素所杀后，将在24小时后作为死灵元素复活。

entries.name: Life Draining Aura
entries: 在每个死灵元素(`necromental`)的回合开始时，距离它15英尺内的每个生物必须通过一次体质豁免检定（豁免 DC 8 + 死灵元素的熟练加值 + 它的体质调整值），否则将受到等于死灵元素两个骰子的死亡伤害。目标还会遭受等同于所受伤害的生命流失。

entries.name: Touch of Death
entries: 当死灵元素对生物造成伤害时，它可以将任意数量的伤害改为(死灵)伤害。

entries.name: Additional Abilities
entries: 死灵术士获得以下行动选项之一。

entries.name: Disrupt Life (Recharge 5-6)
entries: 每个距离死灵元素15英尺内的生物都会受到等于死灵元素四个命中骰的死灵伤害（存活韧性豁免，豁免 DC 8 + 死灵元素的熟练加值 + 它的体质调整值）。

entries.name: Steal Life (Recharge 5-6)
entries: 这个死灵元素从一个15英尺锥形范围内吸取一切生物的生命力。该区域内的每个生物都会受到等于死灵元素两个骰子的死灵伤害（成功体质豁免可减半，豁免 DC 为8 + 死灵元素的熟练加值 + 它的体质调整值）。死灵元素将回复等于对所有目标造成的总伤害量的生命值。

entries.name: Weaken (Recharge 5–6)
entries: 死灵元素(necromental)瞄准在其可见的10英尺范围内的一个或多个活物。每个目标必须进行一次感知豁免检定（豁免 DC 8 + 死灵元素的熟练加值 + 其体质调整值）来抵抗这个魔法。未通过豁免的目标不能使用反应，速度减半，且不能在自己的回合内进行多于一次的攻击。此外，目标在自己的回合内只能选择进行一个动作或一个奖励动作，而不能两者兼有。这些效果持续1分钟（豁免结束）。
This walking pile of crumbling earth and stone radiates a palpable aura of death.

items.name: Combat
entries: An earth necromental smashes into combat like a typical earth elemental, though with even more devastating results, thanks to its necromantic abilities.

entries.name: Necropolitan
entries: 死灵居民是一种人形生物，他们在一种特殊的仪式中放弃生命，拥抱不死之身，这个仪式被称为(十字迁徙仪式)。
一个死城居民的皮肤干燥、枯萎、粉状。它的眼睛苍白如积雪，毫无生气。它仍然穿着它在生前喜欢的时尚。死城居民被认为是位于鲜为人知的城市夜幽之市的市民，但如果他们的本质在其他地方被揭示，他们会像普通怪物一样被恐惧和追捕。

entries.name: In Your Campaign
entries: 虽然死灵镇民并非天生邪恶，但在你的冒险中，许多派系如果发现这些不死生物的存在，就会试图摧毁他们。

entries.name: Necropolitan Template
entries: 只有人形生物或畸变生物才能成为不死族（necropolitan），尽管DM可能会允许其他类型的生物适当地成为不死族。当一个活物（称为基础生物）被转化为不死族时，它保留其统计数据，除非另有说明。

entries.name: Type
entries: 死灵镇民是一种不死生物，它不需要空气、食物、饮料或睡眠。

entries.name: Ability Score Adjustment
entries: 不死都市人的体质属性提高 2 点，最高为 22 点。

entries.name: Damage Immunities
entries: 不死城居民对冷冻、死灵和毒性伤害免疫。

entries.name: Condition Immunities
entries: 不死城居民不能是{@condition charmed|PHB}, {@condition frightened|PHB}, {@condition paralyzed|PHB}, 或者{@condition poisoned|PHB}。它也不受{@condition exhaustion|PHB}的影响。

entries.name: Skills
entries: 不死之城居民在选择两项技能上获得熟练加成，这意味着它在进行相关能力检定时，其熟练加值会加倍。

entries.name: Senses
entries: 亡灵都市人在60英尺内获得{@sense darkvision}。如果基础生物已经拥有暗视力，那么它的暗视半径将增加60英尺。但是，如果基础生物具有致盲视觉并且在其半径之外是盲目的，那么亡灵都市人将不会获得暗视力。

entries.name: Traits, Actions, and Proficiencies
entries: 亡灵城居者失去任何假定为生物生理的特质，比如水生。亡灵城居者可能会保留或失去其巢穴行动中的任何一个或全部，或者根据DM的判断获得新的行动。它还会根据下面的部分描述获得额外的特质。否则，亡灵城居者保留基础生物的熟练项、行动和特质。

entries.name: Additional Traits
entries: 死灵都市人获得以下特征。

entries.name: Aversion of Radiance
entries: 如果(``necropolitan``)受到辐射伤害，它在接下来的回合结束前攻击检定和能力检定都会受到劣势。

entries.name: Clarity of Death
entries: 不死都市居民对任何试图读取其思维、判断其是否在撒谎，或者在魔法上影响其思维或行为的法术或效果免疫。

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries: 不死之城居民在抵抗法术和其他魔法效果的豁免 throws 时具有优势。

entries.name: Negative Energy Absorption
entries: 每当不死城（Necropolitan）受到死灵伤害时，它不会受到伤害，而是恢复等同于所受死灵伤害数值的生命值。

entries.name: Turn Resistance
entries: 不死城镇居民在抵抗使不死生物失效的效果时具有优势。

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: 如果伤害将不死族(necropolitan)的生命值降至0点，它必须进行一次体质豁免检定，难度等于5 + 所受伤害，除非伤害来自辐射或是重击。若成功，不死族将生命值降至1点。

entries.name: Ritual of Crucimigration
entries: 任何人形生物都可以请求考虑接受(转生仪式)Ritual of Crucimigration，如果成功，该生物将成为一个死灵体(necropolitan)。请求考虑需要支付3000金币的费用和一封书面申请。
{@b The Ritual:} 仪式的第一部分需要将请愿者放在一个立柱上。 诅咒的钉子用来固定请愿者，然后将立柱抬起到位。 然后，通过请愿者的手指传来的像熔化的金属一样的剧痛并沿着手臂上升，这并不是最终结束请愿者凡人生命的原因，因为死亡通常来自窒息和心力衰竭。 当请愿者感受到死亡的寒意进入他们的身体时，许多人开始后悔，但现在已经太迟了——诅咒的钉子和仪式的吟唱确保了十字迁徙的完成。
仪式持续24小时——这是请愿者死亡所需的通常时间。在这段时间里，两三个僵尸仆从保持着一种由仪式领导者在请愿者被放置到位置时发起的吟唱。听到请愿者的最后一口气时，仪式领导者会召唤邪恶力量和神灵的名字，与负能量位面建立联系，然后将请愿者刺穿。在垂死之际，请愿者将作为死灵居民重生，死而不僵。
如果仪式在完成之前被打断，请求者只是死了。

This withered humanoid has eyes so blue they are more accurately described as white, as if drained of color and life. The figure wears severe black clothing and clutches a thin wand in one gnarled hand.

items.name: Combat
entries: This necropolitan acts much like a typical mage, though it focuses its attacks on any character prominently displaying a holy symbol or otherwise appearing to be a cleric or paladin.

entries.name: Swarm-Shifter
entries: 那只爆炸成一群蝙蝠的吸血鬼，那只崩解成一堆蝎子的木乃伊——这些是群聚变形者，被赋予黑暗力量变成群聚的不死生物。
一只群体变形者看起来像普通的不死生物，直到它的身体爆炸成一群虫群。有许多种类的群体变形者，尽管有些比其他更常见，但群体变形者似乎并不受其不死形态限制而局限于某种类型的虫群。

entries.name: In Your Campaign
entries: 蜂群变形者模板主要是一个机械工具，用来使遭遇更加难忘，而不是一个叙事工具，用来创造独特的恶棍。然而，能够变成蜂群的能力也可能让一个不死生物轻松地进行侦察或监视区域而不被发现。
群体变形者也擅长利用他们的群体形态来逃脱，这可以用来在你的冒险中建立经常出现的反派角色。

entries.name: Swarm-Shifter Template
entries: 只有不死生物才能成为群体变形者。当一个不死生物（被称为基础生物）成为群体变形者时，它会获得下面的变形特性。请注意，与大多数模板不同，一个不死生物有可能多次获得这个模板，每次应用都会获得一个新的群体选项。

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries: 群体变形者可以使用其奖励动作变形成一群不死生物，从应用此模板时提供的选项列表中选择。群体变形者可以选择其装备是掉落在地上、融入其新形态，还是被新形态穿戴。如果群体变形者死亡或失去意识，它将恢复到真实形态。群体变形者可以在自己的回合使用一个奖励动作恢复到真实形态。
在新形态下，群体变形者保留其游戏统计数据和说话能力，但其移动方式被新形态取代，并获得新形态具有但它缺乏的任何特殊感知、熟练、特质、动作和反应。它失去了依赖于装备或正常身体使用的任何攻击，可以在新形态中用口头或体态成分施放法术。
新形态的攻击被视为魔法攻击，可以克服对非魔法攻击的抗性和免疫。虫群变形者可以选择在新形态的攻击加值或豁免 DC 中使用其正常的攻击加值或豁免 DC 之一。此外，虫群变形者可以选择保持其原始大小，或者变成新形态统计数据中指定的大小。

entries.name: Swarm Options
entries: 在选择群体变形者选项时，任何智力分数为5或更低的微小野兽或不死群体都可以符合资格。此外，下面的属性块被设计为与群体变形者模板配合良好：
A skittering swarm of scorpions five feet across approaches you. The swarm contracts, merging together and compacting. Suddenly, it coalesces into a withered corpse in funeral wrappings.

items.name: Combat
entries: A scorpion-shifter mummy acts much like a regular mummy. It typically prefers to fight while in swarm form, but it may transform back if it is {@condition bloodied|LM}. It may also transform into a swarm as a method of escape; while its swarm form is even slower than its mummy form, its Swarm trait allows it to escape via small openings that its mummy form wouldn't fit through.

entries.name: Umbral Creature
entries: 像影子一样，暗影生物是活生生的黑暗生物。它们同样痛恨生命和光明。它们的触碰带来了不存在的痛苦寒意，使它们成为非常危险的对手。
一个暗影生物看起来像是一个物质生物的阴影版本，很容易被误认为是来自阴影位面的生物。暗影生物在黑暗或阴暗的地方很难被看见，但在明亮照明的地方却很显眼。
所有生物的天敌，阴影生物是具有攻击性和掠食性的。它们迅速发动攻击，迅速解决那些毫无准备来对付它们的生物。

entries.name: Umbral Creature Template
entries: 只有异常(aberration)、龙(dragon)、巨人(giant)、野兽(beast)或畸变(monstrosity)才能成为暗影生物(umbral creature)；人形生物会变成{@creature shadow|MM|shadows}。当一个活物（称为基础生物）成为暗影生物时，除下文所述外，它保留其属性。

entries.name: Type
entries: 暗影生物是一种不死生物，它不需要空气、食物、饮料或睡眠。

entries.name: Armor Class
entries: 暗影生物的护甲等级变为10 +其敏捷调整值（Dexterity modifier）（如果尚未达到），并且失去了天然护甲或其他任何可能拥有的护甲来源。

entries.name: Speed
entries: 暗影生物的行走速度增加10英尺，且失去所有其他形式的移动。

entries.name: Ability Score Adjustment
entries: 暗影生物的敏捷分数增加2点，最高为22，最低为14。但是，如果它的力量分数高于新的敏捷分数，则暗影生物的敏捷将提高到与其力量相匹配。然后，它的力量分数减半，最低为1。

entries.name: Damage Vulnerabilities, Resistances, and Immunities
entries: 暗影生物具有与{@creature shadow}相同的弱点、抗性和免疫力。基础生物的任何弱点、抗性或免疫力都不会被保留。

entries.name: Condition Immunities
entries: 这个阴影生物不能被{@condition frightened|PHB}、缠斗、{@condition paralyzed|PHB}、石化、{@condition poisoned|PHB}、倒地或者束缚。它也不受{@condition exhaustion|PHB}的影响。

entries.name: Senses
entries: 暗影生物获得{@sense darkvision}，范围为60英尺。如果基础生物已经拥有暗视能力，那么它的暗视半径将增加60英尺。暗影生物失去所有其他感官。

entries.name: Traits, Actions, and Proficiencies
entries: 暗影生物失去任何假定具有生理特征的特质，比如（Amphibious），以及依赖于实体存在的特质，比如（Spider Climb）或（Standing Leap）。暗影生物可能会保留或失去其巢穴行动中的任何一个或全部，或者根据DM的判断获得新的行动。根据以下部分描述，它还会获得额外的行动和特质。否则，暗影生物保留基础生物的熟练项、行动和特质。

entries.name: Additional Traits
entries: 目标获得以下特质。

entries.name: Amorphous
entries: 暗影生物可以在不挤压的情况下穿过宽度仅为1英寸的空间。

entries.name: Create Spawn
entries: 当一个非邪恶的人型生物被暗影生物杀死时，1d4小时后，一个阴影从尸体上升起。

entries.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: 在昏暗或黑暗中，(umbral creature)可以将躲藏动作作为一个额外动作，并且在使用潜行技能进行检定时，其熟练加值翻倍。

entries.name: Strength Drain
entries: 当暗影生物对一名生物造成伤害时，目标的力量属性值会减少1d4点。如果这使其力量属性降至0，目标将死亡。否则，这种减少会持续直到目标完成一次短休或长休。

entries.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries: 在阳光下，(umbral creature)的攻击检定、能力检定和豁免检定都具有劣势。

entries.name: Additional Abilities
entries: 目标获得以下动作选项。

entries.name: Withering Touch
entries: 如果基础生物已经可以进行近战武器攻击，它不会获得这个动作；如果攻击是用自然武器进行的（例如爪、拳头、触手或蹄攻击），则造成的伤害类型为死灵伤害，而如果是用制造的武器进行的，则攻击会额外造成等于暗影生物一个骰子的死灵伤害。否则，这次攻击使用暗影生物的敏捷调整值来确定其攻击加值和伤害。这次攻击对一个生物造成死灵伤害，其伤害骰数等于暗影生物的两个骰子。
A murky, vaguely feline shape crouches before you.

items.name: Combat
entries: Umbral displacer beasts rely on their incorporeal-esque nature and their natural displacement to avoid most attacks. Due to their limited Intelligence, they don't typically take full advantage of their abilities, such as focusing targets with less Strength in an attempt to kill them first.

entries.name: Dregoth, the Dread King
entries: 在吉斯特纳尔(Giustenal)的废墟下，一个黑暗的主人正在等待时机。德雷戈斯(Dregoth)的人民将他视为神，这位可怕的国王在绝对的秘密中统治着他重生的城市。他渴望对阿塔斯(Athas)的其他巫师国王复仇，他们在几个世纪前杀死了他，却未能阻止他邪恶的重生。

entries.name: Lore
entries: 角色们并不知道以下传说，因为德雷戈斯(Dregoth)的持续存在仍然对所有人保密。
经过千年，德雷戈斯仍然渴望成为神。他成功地完成了类似神一般的任务，比如采用了类似龙的外表，创造了德雷人（龙裔）作为他的选民。然而，在过去，他的赤裸野心让阿萨斯的其他巫师国王感到不安。
阿巴拉克-瑞(Abalach-Re)警告了其他城邦的霸主，他们合作摧毁了吉斯坦纳尔(Giustenal)及其亵渎者龙君主。吉斯坦纳尔的破碎使得幸存的龙裔居民四散，同时也让被困在巨大奥术战斗中死去的灵魂涌入了灵界。吉斯坦纳尔变成了一个真正的鬼城。
巫师国王们最终未能完成他们的任务。然而，德雷戈斯作为一个庞大而强大的不死生物回到了阿塔斯。他带领他的忠实追随者前往地下深处的一个洞穴。这个地点在很久以前就已经为一个定居点做好了准备，但从未被占领。德雷戈斯要求新吉斯坦纳尔的所有居民——奴隶和市民，贵族和圣殿骑士——都接受龙裔转变。这位可怕的国王相信，这个新种族的崇拜和忠诚将使他得到神格的提升。
德雷戈斯是一位类似巫妖的凯沙加，他的灵魂寄宿在新吉斯特纳尔的一个隐藏魂器中。如果被杀死，他会在三天后再次复活，这个秘密只有他的高阶祭司{@creature Absalom|LM}知道。

entries.name: New Giustenal
entries: 吉斯坦纳尔 (Giustenal) 位于沙砾之海 (Silt Sea) 的边缘，其废墟如同散落的骨骼一般晒白，同样的死寂。在这个荒凉废墟周围的土地上，生命、各种地形和危险充斥着。吉斯坦纳尔 (Giustenal) 那黑暗的阴影已经染污了环绕其沙砾覆盖墙壁的人们的生活和传说，而呼啸穿过其废弃尖塔的诡异风声唤起了他们传说中的令人心悸的旋律。
在他死后和重生后，德雷戈斯（Dregoth）带领吉斯坦纳尔（Giustenal）的幸存者前往阿塔斯（Athas）地表下的一个洞穴。虽然这个洞穴在蓝色时代（Blue Age）曾为一个半身人定居点做好了准备，但从未被占据。德雷戈斯和他的追随者发现了一个空无一人的天堂，等待着被填满。
在新吉斯坦纳尔（New Giustenal）没有任何建筑像城市北部的德雷戈斯恐惧宫（Dregoth's Dread Palace）那样严酷或压迫。它的墙壁由最黑的黑曜石构成，许多巨龙的骨骼装饰着它的表面。
有关更多信息，请参阅第二版盒装套装{@i City by the Silt Sea}。

items.name: Combat
entries: Dregoth spends most of his time in a {@creature Dregoth (Kaisharga Form)|LM|kaisharga form}; he appears as a gray-scaled, dragonlike humanoid whose eyes burn with green fire, but often disguises as a typical dray to blend in with the masses. However, this only gives way to his {@creature Dregoth (Dragon Form)|LM|true form}, an undead dragon with wings, scales, a tail, claws, and a devastating breath weapon. This form was badly damaged by the attack of the sorcerer-kings. So, Dregoth's wings are torn, his body still wears the wounds inflicted upon it, and gaping holes show exposed bone in many places. The armored skin that remains is stretched thinly over the skeleton beneath.

entries.name: Kaisharga Form
entries: In his first form, Dregoth is a fearsome spellcaster, using his strongest spells first via his legendary actions to take out threats as soon as possible. For damage, he prefers to stay back and use Supreme Defiling, Drain Moisture, and Defiling Gaze while his undead minions draw the opponents' attention. If threatened in melee, he uses Telekinetic Movement and Telekinetic Backlash as repositioning tools, and uses his Multiattack with Paralyzing Attack to render them useless as soon as possible.

entries.name: Dragon Form
entries: As an undead dragon, Dregoth is fearless, using Nightmare Travel to dive into the fray, Aura of Fear to send his foes running, and then Draconic Might and Telekinetic Slide to control the battlefield. He still possesses the spellcasting of his kaisharga form, however, and may use his action to cast any of his remaining spells if his Defiling Breath isn't available. When he can catch two or more creatures in it at once, he uses Psychic Crush on them and attacks his stunned opponents with advantage and without fear of reprisal.

Absalom was born human. He was selected as Dregoth's new high priest after Giustenal's fall. He was among the first survivors the undead sorcererking transformed into dray. After transfiguring Absalom, Dregoth slew his high priest and raised him as an undead servitor. Absalom preaches of the Dread King's godhood, but his true loyalty is to the dragonborn, or dray, of New Giustenal.

entries.name: Combat
entries: Absalom hurls insults at his fiercest enemy, marking it as the first to die. He starts combat attacking from range with his {@spell grave bolt|LM} and other spells, then using Baleful Teleport to reposition enemies into his Unmaking Breath. But Absalom is as much warrior as he is priest: once {@condition bloodied|LM}, he moves boldly amongst his foes, slashing at them with his claws and empowered by his Enfeebling Smite. He saves his fell attacks for opponents that threaten his king or his people, otherwise preferring to use Psychic Leadership on his minions so that they may do the dirty work.

entries.name: Kas, the Betrayer
entries: 很久以前，当{@creature Vecna|LM}还是凡人时，Kas是Vecna最信任的副手。他忠实地为Vecna效力了数个世纪，起初是作为邪恶的人类圣武士，后来成为了一个吸血鬼领主。随着时间的推移，Kas开始嫉妒Vecna的力量，并开始密谋反对他。在Vecna的神格化最终仪式中，Kas发动了进攻，希望取代Vecna成为一位神祇。Kas试图摧毁Vecna的企图失败了，但他成功地切断了Vecna的一只手，剜掉了他的一只眼睛，在这场史诗般的战斗中。战斗之激烈以至于摧毁了Vecna的塔楼，并将Vecna和Kas抛到了不同的位面。Kas的阴谋失败了，尽管他保留了自己的力量。

entries.name: Lore
entries: 一个角色通过成功检定{@skill History}或{@skill Religion}技能获得以下信息。

entries.name: DC 20
entries: Kas 是最强大的人形生物之一，他不是一个神。他是一个强大的吸血鬼领主，据传曾击败过几位次级神和原始神灵。他指挥着一支由生者和不死者组成的军队，并受到吸血鬼和卑贱凡人的崇拜和敬仰。

entries.name: DC 25
entries: 卡斯（Kas）又被称为卡斯背叛者，是维克纳（Vecna）的宿敌。他最初是维克纳信任的副手，但为了取代维克纳成为神明而背叛了他。卡斯砍掉了维克纳的手和眼睛，虽然两者都在战斗中幸存下来，但现在彼此都在寻求对方的毁灭。卡斯曾经是一个邪恶的圣武士，他仍然重视一些骑士原则。他异常自豪，永远不会忘记或原谅对他或他的荣誉的侮辱。
卡斯(Kas)与两件神器有关，分别是{@item Sword of Kas}和{@item Silver Mask of Kas|LM}。这些物品已不再在他的手中，如今在各个位面流传，腐化着那些不幸找到它们的人。

entries.name: DC 30
entries: 卡斯（Kas）经常穿梭于各个位面，但他有两个主要的行动基地。他统治着暗影界（Shadowfell）中的一个王国，在那里吸血鬼用铁腕统治着活着的人类。这个王国得到了乌鸦女王（Raven Queen）的容忍，卡斯通过分享关于奥库斯（Orcus）和维克纳（Vecna）的信息来安抚了她。卡斯还会在盖亨纳（Gehenna）的一座隐藏在山脉中的堡垒中度过时间。这座堡垒是一个几乎全黑的坚固要塞，家具都是由精心打磨的黑曜石制成。这座堡垒周围环绕着一道由冥河（River Styx）水源供应的护城河。卡斯王国中的一些囚犯被带到这个领地，作为卡斯和他的盟友们的食物。

entries.name: Castle Tovag
entries: Kas统治着恐惧半位面(Tovag)的领地，在那里，他的吸血鬼手下聚集囚犯士兵，并制造战争机器，为最后一次对抗"低语者"(The Whispered One)做准备。在其核心是Tovag城堡，一个适合真正吸血鬼国王的行动基地。在那里，他协调着他的仆人在各个位面的行动，并制定战斗计划来击败Vecna的手下。

items.name: Combat
entries: Kas has a twisted sense of honor that compels him to offer the appearance of a fair fight to any creatures he considers equals. He quickly dispatches challengers of obvious inferiority. Kas usually strikes first and without warning, and he attempts to subdue an opponent rather than kill it. He has no reservations about attacking an unarmed opponent, but the creature must have access to a nearby weapon. If a combatant proves a good challenge, Kas transforms the creature into a vampire spawn under his control after he defeats it.

Kas is cunning, having learned much of his craft from Vecna. He prefers to fight opponents in areas of darkness, where he has no risk of losing his regeneration. If outnumbered, Kas relies on spellcasting allies that can cast supportive spells on him to ensure victory. Kas revels in combat and tries to engage as many opponents as possible. However, even while engaging multiple foes, he retains wisdom and cunning. Kas is confident of his abilities but makes strategic retreats if necessary. In melee, he disengages with an enemy only long enough to cast {@spell command} or {@spell charm person} on them, which he makes sure to target on the opponent most skilled in melee.

Blackstar knights are undead spirits housed in vessels of animate black stone. Each knight serves Kas unswervingly, though stories of similar beings under the control of other creatures have begun to surface.

entries.name: Combat
entries: Blackstar knights use Death Mark on a single target and relentlessly pursue them using No Escape until either the target or the knight is destroyed, or until commanded by a superior to change its tactics. If ordered to defend a location or creature, it will use Brace to punish creatures that try to breach its defensive position.

entries.name: Lore
entries: A character knows the following information with a successful check made using the {@skill Arcana} or {@skill History} skill.

entries.name: DC 25
entries: These blank-faced stone warriors house souls bound to their rocky forms. The ritual for creating them remains a deeply guarded secret, and possibly one that Kas no longer controls. The presence of blackstar knights and similar beings in the service of other masters aside from Kas supports the possibility that Kas's defenses have been compromised and his secrets revealed.

entries.name: Osterneth, the Bronze Lich
entries: 被称为黑暗至尊之种子和低语者之心，欧斯特涅斯(Osterneth)是维克纳(Vecna)最强大的仆人。欧斯特涅斯的任务是颠覆政府、腐化善良的人们，并带头维克纳接管世界。

在公共场合，奥斯特涅丝(Osterneth)看起来是一个妩媚的、贵族气质的人类女性，大约二十多岁，拥有深色头发和青铜色皮肤。她那温文尔雅的外表被丰富的衣橱和迷人的微笑所强调，能融化男人的心。声称自己来自遥远的贵族之地，奥斯特涅丝利用她的狡诈和魅力在上流社会的后代中获得青睐。引起他们的兴趣后，"低语者之心"(Heart of the Whispered One)便诱使世界上最伟大的领袖，让他们心甘情愿地加入维克纳(Vecna)的崇拜。
实际上，奥斯特内斯(Osterneth)是一个来自一个已经被遗忘的王国的古老巫妖；她的真实形态是一个镶嵌着灵魂宝石的青铜骨骼的无血肉骨架。在她空洞的胸腔内跳动着维克纳(Vecna)的心脏，这是从维克纳原始身体的干瘪遗骸中保存下来的遗物。奥斯特内斯赤裸头骨的眼睛闪耀着七彩光辉，产生强大的魅惑效果，除了她最信任的仆人外，隐藏了她真实的外貌。

entries.name: Lore
entries: 一个角色使用{@skill History}技能成功检查后获得以下信息。

entries.name: DC 20
entries: Osterneth（奥斯特内斯）是一位美丽迷人的贵族女士，受过奥术艺术的教育。她很少谈论自己的过去，但声称是来自遥远王国一个贵族家族的后裔。

entries.name: DC 25
entries: Osterneth在被追问过去细节时总是很含糊。一层神秘的面纱笼罩着她，有些人怀疑她并非表面看起来那样。

entries.name: DC 30
entries: Osterneth对魔法的兴趣主要集中在死灵艺术上，尽管她只是假装有点兴趣。她身边几个亲近的人相继失踪，引起了怀疑。有人声称她参与了某种邪教。

entries.name: Social Encounters
entries: 在社交场合中，奥斯特涅丝(Osterneth)展现出自己的真实面貌，利用她敏锐的直觉和卓越的观察技巧找到合适的方法。她在展示智慧的同时，与赞美之间保持微妙的平衡，更愿意贬低自己，如果这意味着能引诱目标认为他们更优越，从而更愿意展示他们手中的所有牌。

entries.name: Summit of Truth
entries: 尽管他们通常通过类似{@spell sending}的咒语进行交流，但致力于残缺之神的邪教领袖们每年聚集一次，参加由奥斯特涅举办的隐秘的"真相峰会"，在那里他们更新无数阴谋和计划，交换魔法物品和知识，并协调多个邪教细胞之间的合作。真相峰会在被强大结界保护的艾恩神殿中举行，免受预言魔法的影响，是维克纳各个邪教唯一可以确保绝对隐私，即使是神明也无法窥探的地方。

奥斯特涅斯（Osterneth）的魂器是一个插在庙宇中央庭院的伊昂（Ioun）的被斩首雕像——毕竟，没有人会怀疑维克纳（Vecna）的仆人会使用他的竞争对手的形象作为他们永生的来源。在每一次高峰会议上，奥斯特涅斯都会带来她收集的俘虏灵魂，并将它们供奉给她的魂器，为她提供足够的养分来度过接下来的一年。由于施加在上面的{@spell Nystul's magic aura}法术，这座雕像看起来没有魔法，但经过仔细研究10分钟并成功通过一次DC 25的智力检定({@skill Arcana})后，可以辨认出它的真实面目。摧毁魂器的条件之一是恢复雕像的头部，无论是重新连接原始头部还是构建一个足够的替代品（例如使用{@spell stone shape}）。

items.name: Combat
entries: Osterneth relies heavily on the presence of undead allies, using them as meat shields via Redirect Attack and positioning tools via Transposition. She starts combat by attempting to dominate one of the party's melee combatants, spending her action on subsequent turns to cast a spell or to use Void Lightning if it is available, and then using {@spell mislead} and the terrain around her to hide via Cunning Action.

If threatened in melee, Osterneth uses her Paralyzing Touch to paralyze the threat or Luring Glare to move them away from her. While her Shadow Rays are viable enough to use for damage instead of her other spells, Osterneth is always on the lookout for opportunities to catch at least three enemies in a {@spell fireball} or to use {@spell power word kill} to remove a threat from the board.

Wearing only a death shroud, the ascetic of Vecna is a true devotee of the Undying King. An ascetic of Vecna spends its existence contemplating the Maimed God's secrets. The only break from its meditation occurs when the ascetic ventures into the world to collect esoteric knowledge. An ascetic of Vecna is so devoted to the acquisition of knowledge that it fights or kills others to obtain even a minor piece of information. One of these mages gladly exchanges its life to uncover knowledge for its sinister master.

Osterneth works with a circle of powerful ascetics to amass occult lore in the name of The Undying King. These ascetics use spiritual projections to direct the cults they lead while their true selves remain in silent contemplation within hidden chambers known only to other members of the circle, only emerging once per year to gather for the Summit of Truth or to bare arms in dire circumstances.

entries.name: Combat
entries: Ideally, an ascetic of Vecna never has to fight at all—it typically remains locked away in a meditation chamber hidden away from prying eyes, using Dream Stride to direct its underlings' activities and to destroy any possible threats as soon as possible. If a confrontation is inevitable, it will use {@spell clairvoyance}, {@spell find familiar}, and {@spell scrying} to gather as much information on its enemies' numbers and capabilities.
